chargeHist.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License (2nd w/in 3 yrs)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell Glen Anderson

records.addlTxt:
22CF320, 22CF186, 21CF158, 22CF93, 22CF94, 21CF554, 21CF579  11:02 AM Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dan Firkus appeared by video for Mitchell Glen Anderson. Attorney Renee Taber appeared in person for Mitchell Glen Anderson.  DE agrees with Branch 2 handling sentencing.  Atty Firkus agrees with going forward.  Parties waive PSI.  Ct puts JR on the record.  ADA Webster agrees.  Atty Taber agrees.  May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  CT goes over PQWR.  

22CF186: DE pleads G to Count 1 as repeater, but striking 2nd enhancer of certain places on file 22CF186. DE pleads G to Count 2 on file 22CF186. 22CF94: DE pleads G to Count 1 and Count 8 in file 22CF94. 21CF158: DE pleads G to Count 1 on file 21CF158.  CT finds DE FVI&K enters pleas on each count and accepts pleas.  Ct finds DE G and enters judgment on each count.  Waives PSI.  Ct finds DE FVI&K waives PSI.  Ct - All other counts on all other files RI&D w/prej and w/o costs.  ADA Webster addresses Ct.  Atty Taber addresses Ct.  Ct grants 30 days to Atty Taber to calculate jail credit.  Atty Firkus addresses Ct.  

SENTENCING: 

21CF158 - Count 1 Misdm Theft.  $200 DNA SC, fine/costs of $265.60. W/H - Probation 2 years.  

22CF94 - Count 1 W/H sentence - 3 years probation.  $250 DNA SC, fine/costs of $290.60.  
Count 8 Misdm Theft - W/H sentence - 2 years probation.  $200 DNA SC, fine/costs waived.  

22CF186 - W/H 3 years probation.  Count 1 - $250 DNA SC, fine/costs of $300.05.  6 months conditional JT, Subj to WR, not subj to GT, stayed for use of probation.  Restitution to Dresser Food & Liquor $60, plus 10% SC, plus 5% SC for COC.  All fines and costs are a condition of probation, but payable to COC.  Set up PP with COC within 60 days, civil judgement, collections and TI.   Absolute sobriety.  AODA assessment and follow-through. Not to have contact with: Dresser Food & Liquor.  Not to have contact with: DCKW or her property at 2120 200th Avenue.  Not to have contact with: KDK, MJT, JRL, & NRC.  Not to have contact with: JWC or her property at 676 200th Street, County Rd M, Osceola.  Not to possess counterfeit money.  Not to operate motor vehicle w/o valid DL.  Not to possess or use drugs without a prescription or drug paraphernalia. No contact with know users and dealers accept in confined setting or treatment setting.  Follow through with probation.  DE to give true and accurate statements to LE.  

Count 2 - $250 DNA SC, fine/costs waived. 
May not possess or use firearms and, if considered a violent felony, no body armor. Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored. If not a US citizen, may face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.  PCR given. 11:57 adj.

11:52 AM Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson in court, in custody.   Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Mitchell Glen Anderson. AW-clerk.  Parties are in agreement of waiver.    CT-addresses DE and finds the DE FVIK of waiver.  CT-find PC and DE is bound over.  State to file information and match CC.  Atty Firkus waive reading and enter plea of NG.  CT-accepts plea.  Atty Firkus addresses court and request to reinstate Sign bond.  State addresses court.  CT-motion is denied.  Atty Firkus to contact JA for scheduling. Bond conts.  12:01 pm adj
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 11:45 am.

1:44 PM Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Holly Wood Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dan Firkus not in court.  JP-Clerk.  Ct - Atty Firkus has agreed to take case, but unavailable today.  CT finds good cause to extend the PH.  DA office to contact JA to arrange new date/time for a PH.  CT does not modify bond at this time.  1:59 adj.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

CASES 21CF158, 22CF320. 2:03 PM. JL-Clerk. Prosecuting attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson appeared by video, in custody. JA is in the process of scheduling plea/sentencing w/counsel. Bond cont. 2:13 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Bond Covers 22CF320 and 21CF158:  Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.

1:14 PM Defendant Mitchell Glen Anderson in court, in custody.  Attorney Burger appeared for PD Office.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  ADA Webster addresses Ct.  Atty Burger did not contact him, did not realize there were new charges.  Waives reading of charges.  DE addresses Ct.    Ct - Jail to led DE make phone calls to Atty Firkus and Isanti County.  Ct sets bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
